bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Emilie Lawrence Reed, July 1, 1929

div1.p: Kean congratulates Emilie Lawrence Reed on the establishment of her annuity.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Emilie Lawrence Reed, July 1, 1929

opener.dateline:
THE MILITARY SURGEON
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM
WASHINGTON
July 1st
1929

div1.p:
This good fortune of
an annuity for five years for
you makes me very happy-
and I am glad to know of
your pleasure too, through the
telegram that came Saturday
about an hour after I had
telephoned Blossom- I do not
know the why & wherefore of the
five year period but my guess
is that it was not good business
to tie up the principal put
aside for this fund for too long
ahead- The negociation was
conducted through Dr. F. F.
Russell, Care Rockefeller Foun-
dation, 61 Broadway, New York-
I think a few lines to him to
say that you had understood that
he had taken a kind interest
in the matter of the annuity and
wanted to express your appreciation
of it, would not be amiss-

Also a similar letter to General
Ireland, who is at present in
the West but a letter will reach
him at the Multeromah Hotel
Portland, Oregon. Mrs Ireland is with him
Mrs Kean sends her congratula-
tions and good wishes-

The donors want to remain
strictly anonymous so I would
not encourage any guessing as
to their identity if I were you-

I must go now to the funeral
of poor Charles Willcox of our
Corps who died Friday after
an operation at Walter Reed
Hospital- He married Jane Augus you know.
With love and congratulations
to you, and Blossom too
div1.closer:
Sincerely your friend J. R. Kean I suppose that the papers from
the Equitable Trust Co have come
by this time and that you signed
them & sent them back promptly
so as to get the first payment
before this week is out-
